Beautiful and dangerous, kilia mwibos appear as lush, green trees with brightly colored and appealing fleshy seedpods that remain attached year round. Over time, these seedpods become hollow and create an eerie, forlorn wail that generates feelings of sadness and despair. **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Kilia Mwibo](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1665) **Source** [Pathfinder #172: Secrets of the Temple City](/Sources.aspx?ID=102) pg. 84 **Perception** +26; emotion sense 60 feet **Languages** [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +30, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +25, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +28 **Str** +7 **Dex** +5 **Con** +3 **Int** -2 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +0 **Emotion Sense** A kilia mwibo can sense nearby negative emotions. This is a precise sense against creatures who are under powerful [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) effects like [rage](/Actions.aspx?ID=3), those who are [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19), or, at the GM's discretion, those who are in the grips of hatred, sadness, or other overwhelming negative emotions. Against all other creatures that possess emotions, this is an imprecise sense. A creature that has no emotions is effectively invisible to a kilia mwibo. A creature that knows about emotion sense can take precautions to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62) and [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63) from a kilia mwibo, in this case by suppressing feelings of negativity. You can flnd more details on hiding from special senses [here](/Rules.aspx?ID=414). --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +24 **Ref** +29 **Will** +26 **HP** 345 **Immunities** critical hits, precision, vision-based effects **Resistances** [sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147) 15 **Weaknesses** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 15, slashing 15 **Despairing Presence** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) 60 feet. A creature that enters the emanation or starts its turn within it tumbles down a deep well of dread and must attempt a DC 33 Will save.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target becomes [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19).
**Failure** The target becomes frightened 2.
**Critical Failure** The target becomes frightened 3 and [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) until it's no longer frightened.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** Frond only. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** frond +30 ([deadly d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 3d10+15 slashing plus 1d6 bleed and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Melee** root +28 ([reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 3d8+15 bludgeoning **Ranged** thorn +28 ([deadly d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d6+15 piercing **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 2d12+15, DC 36 **Consume Emotion** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) The kilia mwibo feeds on the negative emotions of a creature within 60 feet; this must be a creature that it can precisely sense with its emotion sense. The target must succeed at a DC 36 Will save or increase its [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) condition value by 1 (by 2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of drained 4.
Fear Feeders Instead of drawing sustenance from light and soil, kilia mwibos gorge themselves on the negative emotions of creatures, eventually draining them of their life force and discarding their carcasses. When creatures recognize the true nature of the kilia mwibos and attempt to flee, the trees send out buried roots to trip and slow them down before grabbing them with their thorny fronds.
name: Kilia Mwibo
